title: Ticket #4211: Add #ifdef-like mechanism to config file parser
description:
We would like to be able improve the config file syntax, and add new features with clean and clear syntax. But we are also reluctant to make changes that make it impossible for lder versions of HTCondor to parse the config files.

If there was a way to mark sections of the config file to be ignored by older versions of HTCondor, then it would be much safer and easier for users to opt-in to new features without having to worry about preventing older daemons or tools from starting.

To support this the 8.1.x series (and thus the 8.2.x series) should have the ability to parse something like the C++ #ifdef/#endif to mark off sections of the config file.

The config file will be able to parse 

    if <condition1>
       <config_statements_1>
    elif <condition2>
       <config_statements_2>
    else
       <config_statements_3>
    endif

where condition can be

  • a Boolean value (e.g. 0,1,yes,no,true,false). Boolean, Integer and floating point values are allowed. 0 is treated as false, all other numeric values are true. Question: should crufty booleans (t,T,f,F) be allowed?

  • version <compare_operator> <version_string> (e.g. version > [v]8.1). Version literal values must be 2 or 3 integers separated by . and optionally proceeded by v. The v prefix is to allow for version comparisons to migrate into classads at some point in the future. For the same reason, the keyword version is case-insensitive. Note: HTCondor currently doesn't permit version numbers starting with values < 6.

  • defined <param_name> (e.g. defined SLOT_TYPE_1). Evaluates to true if <param_name> is defined and not empty. We treat empty as undefined because it isn't possible to undefine built-in params, but they can be overridden with empty values, and because the result of expanding $(param_name) is the same in both cases.

In the example above, the config system will parse and insert statements in <config_statements_1> if <condition1> is true, and will ignore (and not parse!) those in <config_statements_2> and <config_statements_3>. Not parsing is a key requirement, as it allows new syntax to be used inside blocks where <condition> evaluates to false: 

    if version >= 8.3
       ...config statements not valid to 8.2.x config parser....
    else
       ...config statements that 8.2.x can parse...
    endif

The if/elif/else/endif capability will also be useful when defining meta knobs whose behavior is influenced by user-defined knobs.

The <condition> of an if/elif will will first be macro-expanded. Then version and defined expressions will be evaluated and replaced with 0 or 1, and then the final result evaluated for truth. (in theory - the initial implementation will not actually have 3 passes).

The initial version of this feature will not support complex conditional expressions, but it is important to get if <bool>, if version, and if defined into the 8.2 series to enable future improvements without breaking compatibility.

Some examples: 

if 1
 iftest=one
else
 if 0
  iftest=two
 else
  iftest=three
 endif
endif
# expected result is iftest=three

if defined iftestb
 iftestbd=iftestb defined
elif defined $(iftest)
 iftestbd=iftest defined
elif ! defined $(iftestb)
 iftestbd=iftestb not defined
else
 iftestbd=four
endif
# expected result is iftestbd=four

# test version
iftver_test=8.0.6
if version >= $(iftver_test)
  iftestver= version >= $(iftver_test)
else
  iftestver= version < $(iftver_test)
endif
# expected result is iftestver=version < 8.0.6

# test version equality
if version == 8.1.4
  iftestveris= is 8.1.4
else
  iftestveris=is not 8.1.4
endif
# expected result is iftestveris=is not 8.1.4

# test version fuzzy equality
if version == 8.1
  iftestveris= is 8.1
else
  iftestveris=is not 8.1
endif
# expected result is iftestveris=is 8.1

# test undef==false for references
if ! $(TESTING_UNDEF)
   UNDEF_VALUE = 1
endif
# expected result is UNDEV_VALUE=1
remarks:
2014-Feb-13 09:10:06 by bbockelm:
Hi TJ,

Why not have something compatible with ClassAd expressions? I have a hard time believing that HTCondor needs Yet Another expression language!!!

The only tweak needed to the proposal is to remove "defined" as a keyword and make it into a function (or simply 'foo isnt null').

I think this is very, very important!

Brian

2014-Feb-13 09:57:54 by johnkn:
Actually, I would have loved to use the classad expression parser/evaluator. But unfortunately, the params aren't in a classad. so their values would be unavailable to the expression parser unless we did param macro substitution before evaluation. That is, you can't do this 

    if RELEASE_DIR isnt undefined

Because RELEASE_DIR is not a classad attribute, and you can't do this either 

    if $(RELEASE_DIR) isnt undefined

Because this translates into either 

    if c:\condor isnt undefined

or 

    if  isnt undefined

2014-Feb-14 15:07:42 by eje:
It would be good to commit any unit testing (and/or other kinds of testing) code.
